title: ash and cinder
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:info:start]]
This is a poem about [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/ralliston-s-proposal Ralliston's Proposal], written for [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/from-120-s-archives-hub From 120's Archives.]
[[include :scp-wiki:info:end]]

[[include :scp-wiki:theme:foxtrot poland=a|dark=a]]

The following piece of poetry was discovered by a RAISA employee after an inspection of all SCP-001 files was conducted. Specifically, the poem relates to [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/ralliston-s-proposal SCP-001-RST]. The original poem was found written in chalk, 2 km away from the entrance of the sleeping quarters on a wall next to a worker's bed who had gone missing.[[footnote]] No body was found and the logs for who the bed number belonged to could not be found. Thus, the worker who wrote the poem is uncredited. [[/footnote]]   

The poem has been written over and translated to modern English by Dr. ████.

------

[[=]]

__ash and cinder__

thick dust
coal crushed
lungs cough
die soft

pistons and bolts
needles and jolts
room of despair
darkness beware

bone fragment
brain stagnant
rock hard
glass shard
powder stain
endless pain
black light
beyond sight

dead and buried
arms and sticks
legs and splints
heads and casts
blood at last

gone to darkness
gone to starlight
gone to forever
gone to ash
and gone to cinder
[[/=]]
